com.communote.server.persistence.user

Class ExternalUserVO

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.api.core.user.UserVO
      • com.communote.server.persistence.user.ExternalUserVO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class ExternalUserVO
extends UserVO
implements Serializable
    A value object representing a User retrieved from an external repository like LDAP.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExternalUserVO

        public ExternalUserVO()
        Empty constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • getAdditionalProperty

        public String getAdditionalProperty()
        An optional member holding some additional data for the user. The interpretation depends on the external system. For LDAP it would hold the DN for example.
        Returns:
        the additional property

      • getDefaultLanguage

        public Locale getDefaultLanguage()
        The default language is used if the external user is not yet created.
        Returns:
        the default language for this user

      • getExternalUserName

        public String getExternalUserName()
        Login name of the user in the external repository. This user name will be used to create a Communote alias, if the external user does not yet exist within Communote and the external repository does not provide another property whose value is to be used as Communote user alias. If the user name is not a legal Communote alias the local part of the email address is used as alias.
        Returns:
        the external user name

      • getPermanentId

        public String getPermanentId()
        Optional attribute that represents a unique identifier of the user in the external repository whose value never changes.
        Returns:
        the permanent id

      • getProperties

        public Set<StringPropertyTO> getProperties()
        Returns:
        the properties

      • getStatus

        public UserStatus getStatus()
        Status of the user to be set. This allows deactivating a user who was disabled or removed from the external repository.
        Returns:
        the status

      • getSystemId

        public String getSystemId()
        Returns:
        the system id

      • isClearPassword

        public boolean isClearPassword()
        Whether to clear the password of the local user.
        Returns:
        true if the password should be cleared
        Since:
        3.5

      • isUpdateEmail

        public boolean isUpdateEmail()
        Whether to update the email address of the user if it is provided. Setting this to false will prevent synchronization of an existing local user entry with data retrieved from the external repository.
        Returns:
        the email

      • isUpdateFirstName

        public boolean isUpdateFirstName()
        Whether to update the first name if it is provided. Setting this to false will prevent synchronization of an existing local user entry with data retrieved from the external repository.
        Returns:
        the first name

      • isUpdateLanguage

        public boolean isUpdateLanguage()
        Whether to update the language if it is provided. Setting this to false will prevent synchronization of an existing local user entry with data retrieved from the external repository.
        Returns:
        the language

      • isUpdateLastName

        public boolean isUpdateLastName()
        Whether to update the last name if it is provided. Setting this to false will prevent synchronization of an existing local user entry with data retrieved from the external repository.
        Returns:
        the last name

      • setAdditionalProperty

        public void setAdditionalProperty(String additionalProperty)
        Set the additional property.
        Parameters:
        additionalProperty - the additional property

      • setClearPassword

        public void setClearPassword(boolean clearPassword)
        Set whether a password stored for the local user belonging to this external user should be cleared. This should be true if this VO was created by the primary authentication provider to avoid logins with an old password after changing it in the external system.
        Parameters:
        clearPassword - true to clear the password
        Since:
        3.5

      • setDefaultLanguage

        public void setDefaultLanguage(Locale defaultLanguage)
        The default language is used if the external user is not yet created. If you want the language to be it for the user even he may already choosen another language use UserVO.setLanguage(Locale)
        Parameters:
        defaultLanguage - the default language

      • setExternalUserName

        public void setExternalUserName(String externalUserName)
        Set the external user name.
        Parameters:
        externalUserName - the external user name

        Parameters:
        permanentId - the permanent id
